text.p: Travelers Group Inc said its board of directors authorized the company to repurchase up to an additional $1 billion of its common stock.
The board also voted to keep the quarterly dividend at $0.15 a share on a post-split basis, which represents a 33-1/3 percent increase in the dividend, Travelers said.
In late October, the board declared a 4-for-3 stock split and approved the company's regular quarterly dividend of $0.15 a share on a pre-split basis.
Travelers said the first quarter dividend is payable on February 21, 1997 to stockholders of record on February 3, 1997.

Meanwhile, Travelers said the stock repurchases, which may be made from time to time, will be used for the issuance of stock in conjunction with the ongoing requirements of employee stock option and other benefit plans.
Travelers said it repurchased about 17.3 million common shares in 1996 following the board's previous $600 million authorization made in March 1996.
In addition, Travelers said the board declared a quarterly dividend on the company's series A preferred stock, payable March 1, 1997 to holders of record on February 15, 1997.
Holders of depositary receipts, each representing 1/10 of a full preferred share, will be paid $0.507813 for each receipt held.
The board also declared a quarterly dividend on the company's series D preferred stock, payable April 1, 1997 to holders of record on March 1, 1997.
Holders of depositary receipts, each representing 1/2 of a full preferred share, will be paid $0.578125 for each receipt held.
